com.remote.remote2d.engine.entity.component

Class Component

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.remote.remote2d.engine.entity.EditorObject
      • com.remote.remote2d.engine.entity.component.Component
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    R2DFileSaver
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ComponentCamera, ComponentColliderBox, ComponentPlayer, ComponentRenderer, ComponentTopDownPlayer

    public abstract class Component
extends EditorObject
    A component is an "attachment" to an entity, which modifies its behavior. Components are advantageous because they can be reused on entities, allowing more to be done in-editor and less in code. A component MUST FILL these requirements:
    1. MUST be a direct subclass of component (can't be subclass of subclass of Component)
    2. Constructor CAN NOT have parameters, and must call super()
    Author:
    Flafla2

      • tick

        public abstract void tick(int i,
        int j,
        int k)
        A normal tick method for this component IN GAME. Not in the editor! Note: if the entity is static then this isn't called.

      • renderBefore

        public abstract void renderBefore(boolean editor,
                float interpolation)
        A render method for before the entity renders (but not necessarily directly before; other components may get in between).

      • onEntitySpawn

        public abstract void onEntitySpawn()
        Triggered when the entity spawns into the world. Mostly used for components that set variables for the entity.

      • renderAfter

        public abstract void renderAfter(boolean editor,
               float interpolation)
        A render method for after the entity renders (not necessarily directly after; other components may get in between).
